thread.title: Hawaiian Airlines flies 7.5 percent more passengers in June
thread.title_full: Hawaiian Airlines flies 7.5 percent more passengers in June

author: Jason Ubay
title: Hawaiian Airlines flies 7.5 percent more passengers in June
text:
Hawaiian Airlines flies 7.5 percent more passengers in June Jul 8, 2015, 2:46pm HST Courtesy Hawaiian Airlines Hawaiian Airlines saw passenger traffic increase 7.5 percent in June, compared to June… more Hawaiian Airlines flew 950,761 passengers in June, 7.5 percent more than the 884,559 passengers it flew in same month of 2014, the Honolulu-based carrier said Wednesday. Hawaiian Airlines, a subsidiary of Hawaiian Holdings, Inc. (Nasdaq: HA), saw traffic — or revenue passenger miles — increase 5.8 percent year-over-year in June and capacity — or available seat miles — grow 4.5 percent. Its load factor, or percentage of seating capacity filled, was 84.2 percent for the month, a 1.1 percentage point rise. For the second quarter, the airline’s passenger count grew 5.3 percent to 2.66 million from 2.53 million in the same quarter a year ago. Traffic rose 5.8 percent and capacity gained 4.2 percent. The airline’s load factor was 80.8 percent, a 1.2 percentage-point increase from 79.6 percent in 2014’s second quarter. Through the first half of the year, Hawaiian Airlines transported 5.1 percent more passengers than it did last year, flying 5.18 million passengers through June compared to 4.93 million passengers in 2014. Traffic rose 4.7 percent and capacity climbed 4.5 percent. Its load factor bumped up slightly by 0.2 percentage points to 80 percent from 79.8 percent.
